  • Method Details

    • getLookupOptions

      List<LookupOption> getLookupOptions(String options)
      Translates the options provided over the HTTP interface to something palatable by the service layer
      Parameters:
      options - the list of options, comma-separated.
      Returns:
      a list of LookupOption

    • trim

      Set<LookupOption> trim(List<LookupOption> options, String version, List<String> extraVersions, InterlinearMode mode, List<TrimmedLookupOption> trimmingExplanations)
      Trims the options down to what is supported by the version.
      Parameters:
      options - the options
      version - the version that is being selected
      extraVersions - the secondary selected versions
      mode - the display mode, because we remove some options depending on what is selected
      trimmingExplanations - can be null, if provided then it is populated with the reasons why an option has been removed. If trimmingExplanations is not null, then it is assume that we do not want to rewrite the displayMode
      Returns:
      a new list of options where both list have been intersected.

    • trim

      Set<LookupOption> trim(List<LookupOption> options, String version, List<String> extraVersions, InterlinearMode mode, InterlinearMode finalMode, List<TrimmedLookupOption> trimmingExplanations)
      Similary to trim(), but provides the final display mode as well as the originating display mode
      Parameters:
      options - the options
      version - the version that is being selected
      extraVersions - the secondary selected versions
      mode - the original display mode, because we remove some options depending on what is selected
      finalMode - the final display mode, because we remove some options depending on what is selected
      trimmingExplanations - can be null, if provided then it is populated with the reasons why an option has been removed. If trimmingExplanations is not null, then it is assume that we do not want to rewrite the displayMode
      Returns:
      a new list of options where both list have been intersected.

    • determineDisplayMode

      InterlinearMode determineDisplayMode(List<LookupOption> options, InterlinearMode mode, boolean override)
      Determine display mode: which if NONE and there are interlinear options, we override to interlinear. If we're not explaining options (but rather getting the full list of options), then we simply return the passed in display mode.
      Parameters:
      options - the options
      mode - the mode
      override - true if overrides are allowed
      Returns:
      the interlinear mode

    • getAvailableFeaturesForVersion

      AvailableFeatures getAvailableFeaturesForVersion(String version, List<String> extraVersions, String displayMode, InterlinearMode finalDisplayMode)
      Gets the available features for version.
      Parameters:
      version - the version
      displayMode - the display mode
      finalDisplayMode - the final mode as calculated
      Returns:
      the available features for version

    • getDisplayMode

      InterlinearMode getDisplayMode(String interlinearMode, String mainBook, List<String> extraVersions)
      Parameters:
      interlinearMode - a selected interlinear mode
      Returns:
      returns NONE if null, or the value of String as a InterlinearMode enumeration.

    • optionsToString

      String optionsToString(Collection<LookupOption> options)
      Parameters:
      options - the available features to this version
      Returns:
      the options in coded form
